clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Opioids in Coronary Heart Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Past Medications in Patients With Coronary Heart Disease and Patients Hospitalized for a Non-cardiac Reason

brief_summary.textblock:
In this study, the risk of opioid medications on coronary heart disease in adults is investigated. Patients with the necessity of a coronary angiography and control patients with a non-cardiac disease of the same hospital are inquired with a standardized questionnaire about demographic and clinical risk factors for heart attack. An impact of opioid medications on coronary heart disease is hypothesised (MIOP).
In addition, all patients with coronary angiography should be consulted twice (after 3 and 6 months) to find out how many of these patients have developed a refractory angina pectoris (TRAPS).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with opioid treatment (WHO II/ WHO III) within the last 10 years before present hospitalization, Interview with standardized CRF
primary_outcome.description: Standardized assessment of opioid medications taken before hospital admission to evaluate the impact of opioids in coronary heart disease. Exact doses, substances and intake habits are inquired.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with refractory angina pectoris, Interview with standardized CRF
primary_outcome.description: Standardized assessment of angina pectoris symptoms and treatments to evaluate a refractory angina pectoris. Changes of their medications are inquired twice.
